class DataCallSignalProcessor

Detailed Description

The class DataCallHdl supplies an interface to setup circuit switched data calls.

Member Function Documentation

void DataCallHdl::Init (  const DataCallContext &  context  )  [static]
 

Initializes the DataCallHdl with a defined context (containing variable data call parameter).

CallApiRc DataCallHdl::Release (   )  [static]
 

Sends a data call release request signal to the protocol stack. The release cause will be defaulted internally. The release is always successful, except if no data call exists.

Returns:
NoError if release request was successfully sent.

DataCallRequired if no data call currently exists.

CallApiRc DataCallHdl::Setup (  const PhoneNumber &  phone_no,
BOOLEAN  isdn,
UINT  data_rate,
DataCallControl *  dcc_p
)  [static]
 

Sets up a circuit switched data call.

Parameters:
phone_no The destination phone number.
isdn Defines if the data call type is analog (FALSE) or digital (TRUE).
data_rate The value defines the data rate. E.g. a value of 14400 defines the respective data rate.
Returns:
DataCallDetected if an active call data alreay exists, SetupCallDetected if a voice call çn setup phase exists, ActiveCallDetected if an active voice call exists, HeldCallDetected if a held voice call exists. NoError if signal successfully sent.
